meanings.definition: To argue or dispute angrily or noisily.
meanings.sent1: The siblings would often wrangle over who got to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors would wrangle about the property line, each claiming it was on their side.
meanings.sent3: The two friends would playfully wrangle over who was the better cook, each trying to outdo the other.
meanings.sent4: The politicians continued to wrangle over the budget, unable to reach a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The students would wrangle over the last piece of pizza, each trying to grab it first.

meanings.sent1: The wrangle between the two teams could be heard from across the field.
meanings.sent2: The family tried to avoid the annual holiday wrangle by planning separate celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The wrangle between the cats over the sunny spot on the couch was quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: The wrangle of opinions in the meeting room made it difficult to come to a decision.
meanings.sent5: The children's playful wrangle over the last cookie brought laughter to the room.
